result.execSummary:
The defendant Vanessa Hope Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. 

NO CONTACT with Victim in case 21CM1609.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Cash bail on deposit in case 21CM1609 applied to Cost/Surcharge.  Remaining balance to be refunded to poster.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  Court grants 3 days credit if revoked.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vanessa Hope Ramirez

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty. Ricardo Tapia

09:25 AM Defendant Vanessa Hope Ramirez in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to count 10.
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 10
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 9, 11, 12 and 13. 

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:3 YEARS
Initial Confinement: 18 MONTHS
Extended Supervision: 18 MONTHS
If revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

STAYED FOR PROBATION
Term of Probation: 3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF Probation:  
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 No contact with:  victim in 21CM1609
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $ 268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

CONDITION TIME: 60 Days Waukesha County Jail wtih huber, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  3 Days credit if revoked.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Any monies posted in case 21CM1609 that is left from payment of fine/fee/surcharges in that matter to be applied to the fine/fee/surcharges in this matter.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Atty Tapia requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Atty Tapia requests a new date and an offer in this matter. 
State does not object.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.
The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Compliant with terms of probation in case 21CM1243

02:29 PM Defendant Vanessa Hope Ramirez in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Atty Tapia does accept receipt of the criminal complaint, waive reading and enter not guilty pleas.
